title: Skilled Nursing
shortDescription: Licensed nursing care including medication administration, tube feeding, tracheostomy care, and medical monitoring.
description: Skilled Nursing services provide licensed nursing care for children and individuals with complex medical needs. Services include medication administration, tube feeding (G-tube and NG-tube), tracheostomy care, wound care, seizure monitoring, and ongoing medical assessment. These services are commonly offered at Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care (PPEC) centers, in-home nursing programs, and specialized pediatric facilities. Skilled nurses work closely with physicians, therapists, and families to ensure safe, coordinated care throughout the day.
benefits: Licensed nurses providing direct medical care
Coordination with physicians and therapy teams
Allows medically complex children to receive care outside the hospital
whoCanBenefit: Individuals requiring tube feeding or tracheostomy care
Those needing daily medication administration and monitoring
Families seeking skilled in-home nursing support
